instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery problem
threads.message:
This board had some water damage but not really nothing visable. But I had to replace the connector for the touchpad on the board because it was corroded. 
The problem is the battery. It boots with only battery connected but after 30-60 sec it turns off. If I unplug MagSafe when the computer is running it runs from the battery for 30-60 sec and then it turns off. 
The battery is charging and there is no X on the battery icon in OS x

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery problem
threads.message: Percentage going up when charging, BIL working? Seems like just a dead battery to me.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery problem
threads.message: BIL is not working. Battery was 80% and when I remien MagSafe it was 86%. Original battery with 176 cykles. I don't have any other battery for this model.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery problem
threads.message: Sorry. BIL works but only when MagSafe is connected

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery problem
threads.message: Still sounds like the battery to me. You can test with a 13" or 15" battery as I believe they are the same 10.8/10.95V but double check the voltage.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery problem
threads.message:
Tried a new battery but no difference.
It sometimes worked for 15 min running from only battery.
But now i found liquid damage around <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>, some bad traces. Replaced a couple of components and now it works!!
